intro: Rondeletia cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
